BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Low avalanche danger, beware danger of falling
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger is generally low. On high-altitude east-facing slopes there are snowdrift patches. In Niedere Tauern, Ennstal and Eisenerz Alps, isolated naturally triggered gliding snow slids are possible. The snowpack is hard and icy up to the summits - acute danger of falling.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Older snowdrift accumulations on east-facing slopes at high altitudes are poorly bonded with the surface. Due to warmth and subsequent cooling the snowpack was able to consolidate. The surface is mostly hard and icy.
BulletinMeasurements.wxSynopsisComment: Perfect mountain weather on Monday. Light winds (shifting from north to east to southeast). At 2000 m: +4 degrees.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Ongoingly sunny and mild. Avalanche danger levels are not expected to change significantly.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Persistent-weak-layer problem on E/N facing slopes
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger above 2000 m is moderate, below that altitude danger is low.Main problem: persistent weak layer. Older snowdrift accumulations can be triggered by large additional loading. The few danager zones occur at summit level behind discontinuities and on leeward slopes (also distant from ridges). In addition, isolated gliding snow activity and glide-snow avalanches canâ€™t be excluded. Due to higher temperatures and solar radiation, naturally triggered loose-snow avalanches are possible on extremely steep rough and rocky slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: At high altitudes the older snowdrifts lie deposited atop a hardened layer or atop faceted crystals. The fundament is stable. Leeward slopes are currently without snow. At intermediate altitudes the surface is hard and icy. On sunny slopes firn snow is being produced. On extremely steep shady slopes surface hoar is forming and faceted crystals are weakening the snowpack.
BulletinMeasurements.wxSynopsisComment: Perfect mountain weather on Monday. Light winds (shifting from north to east to southeast). At 2000 m: +4 degrees (zero-degree level at Dachstein-summit altitude).
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Ongoingly sunny and mild. Avalanche danger levels will decrease.
